hints.content: Let's count how many plants had a height of $5\text{ cm}$.

Francis and Giancarlo have plants that grew $5\text{ cm}$.

So, we place $2$ dots over $\greenE{5}$ on the number line.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/573090139f915ae551ad674e50ec41ac3b3c7343)
Now, let's graph the other measurements on the table.

Here is the completed line plot:

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/9b22fc683ed435e4414fc4c010ea5211c410bf11)

question.content:
The students in Ms. Carbon's second grade class each measured their plant's growth this week.   The students are going to make a line plot of the data.  

Student | Plant height ($\text{cm}$)
:-: | :-: | :-:
Louise | $7$
Francis | $5$
Amanda | $7$
Giancarlo | $5$
Annabeth | $8$

**Graph the measurements from the table on the line plot.**   
*Click above the line plot to make dots for each of the measurements.*

[[â˜ƒ plotter 1]]
